intro: Cancrinia botschantzevii, commonly known as the Botswana daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous small flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
